lines.content: * This class encapsulates my version of Duke, called Rat.
* Rat is a chatbot that helps the user keep track of their tasks.
* The RatStorage object used to store the user's tasks in local storage.
* The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* The RatInput Object used to process user input.
* The Scanner object used to read user input.
* Instantiates a RatTaskManager object, Scanner object, and a RatInput Object.
* This class encapsulates a command that adds a task to the task list.
* The type of task to be added.
* The user input passed from RatInput that contains details of the task to be added.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* @param input The user input passed from RatInput that contains details of the task to be added.
* @param commandType The type of task to be added.
public AddCommand(RatTaskManager ratTaskManager, String input, CommandType commandType) {
* Adds a ToDo task to the task list.
* @param params The user input passed from RatInput that contains details of the task to be added.
printWithLines("To Do name cannot be empty");
* Adds a Deadline task to the task list.
* @param params The user input passed from RatInput that contains details of the task to be added.
printWithLines("Invalid date format. Please use \"dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm\"");
* Adds an Event task to the task list.
* @param params The user input passed from RatInput that contains details of the task to be added.
printWithLines("Invalid date format. Please use \"dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm\"");
* This enum encapsulates the different types of commands that Rat can handle.
MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, LIST, BYE, HELP
* This class encapsulates a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* @param input The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be deleted.
printWithLines(" \"delete\" command must be followed by a number");
* This class encapsulates a command that exits the program.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* This class encapsulates a Find command.
* A find command searches the task list for tasks that contain a keyword, and prints the matching tasks to the user.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* This class encapsulates a command that marks a task as done.
* The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be marked as done.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* @param inputs The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be marked as done.
printWithLines(" \"mark\" command must be followed by a number");
* This class encapsulates a command that modifies the task list.
* A modification is either a marking or unmarking of a task as done/undone.
public abstract class ModifyCommand extends RatCommand {
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* This class encapsulates the commands that can be executed by Rat.
* Each command has a corresponding 'execute' method that is called by RatInput.
* The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* This RatTaskManager should be initialised in main.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* Validates the time input by the user.
* @param time The time input by the user.
* @return True if the time is valid, false otherwise.
* @throws ParseException If the time is not in the correct format.
protected static boolean validateTime(String time) throws ParseException {
* This class encapsulates a command that marks a task as not done.
* The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be marked as not done.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* @param inputs The user input passed from RatInput that contains the index of the task to be marked as not done.
printWithLines(" \"mark\" command must be followed by a number");
* This class encapsulates the input handling of Rat.
* The Scanner object used to read user input.
* This Scanner should be initialised in main.
* The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* This RatTaskManager should be initialised in main.
* @param sc             The Scanner object used to read user input.
* @param ratTaskManager The RatTaskManager object used to store and process the user's tasks.
* Parses and processes the user input based on a set of commands.
* Creates and executes the corresponding command object.
printWithLines("Sorry, I don't understand what you mean by " + input);
* Prints the list of commands that the user can use.
String output = "Hello! I'm Rat, your personal task manager.\n"
+ "Here are the commands you can use:\n"
+ "unmark <index>: mark task at <index> as not done\n"
+ "deadline <name> /by <deadline>: add a deadline task with <name> and <deadline>\n"
+ "event <name> /from <start> /to <end>: add an event task with <name>, <start> and <end>\n"
* This class encapsulates the printing of messages by Rat.
* Prints the welcome message to the user.
* The welcome message includes the current local date and time.
String currentTime = LocalDateTime.now().format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm"));
+ "              What can I do for you?\n"
+ "       type \"help\" to see a list of commands";
* Prints the exit message to the user.
String exitMsg = "           Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Given a message, formats the message with lines and prints it to the user.
* @param msg The message to be printed.
* This class encapsulates the logic of handling the storage of Rat,
* which includes reading and writing to a file.
* The file path of the file to be read from and written to.
* @param filePath The file path of the file to be read from and written to.
* Checks if the file is empty.
* @return True if the file is empty, false otherwise.
* Overwrites the file with the given input.
* @param input The input to overwrite the file with.
* Reads the file and returns its contents as a String.
* @return The contents of the file as a String.
* This class encapsulates a Deadline task.
* A Deadline task is a task with a deadline as a String.
* The deadline of the task, represented by a LocalDateTime object.
* The deadline of the task, represented by a String.
* This constructor uses a String to represent the deadline of the task.
* Used during regular runtime of Rat where user enters data from the command line.
* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* @param name The name of the task.
* This constructor uses a LocalDateTime object to represent the deadline of the task.
* Used when reading data from a file.
* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* @param name The name of the task.
* Returns a String representation of a Deadline task.
* The String representation of a Deadline task is its name prefixed by its status and type.
* @return A String representation of a Deadline task.
* Returns a String representation of a Deadline task that is used to write to a file.
* @return The String representation of a Deadline task in the format used to write to a file.
* This class encapsulates an Event task.
* An Event task is a task with a start time and end time as Strings.
* The start time of the task, represented by a LocalDateTime object.
* The end time of the task, represented by a String.
* The start time of the task, represented by a String.
* The date and time is formatted as "EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm".
* The end time of the task, represented by a String.
* The date and time is formatted as "EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm".
* This constructor uses Strings to represent the start time and end time of the task.
* Used during regular runtime of Rat where user enters data from the command line.
* @param startTime The start time of the task.
* @param endTime The end time of the task.
* @param name The name of the task.
protected Event(String startTime, String endTime, String name) {
* This constructor uses LocalDateTime objects to represent the start time and end time of the task.
* Used when reading data from a file.
* @param startTime The start time of the task.
* @param endTime The end time of the task.
* @param name The name of the task.
protected Event(LocalDateTime startTime, LocalDateTime endTime, String name) {
* Returns a String representation of an Event task.
* The String representation of an Event task is its name prefixed by its status and type.
* @return A String representation of an Event task.
return taskType + super.toString() + " (from: " + this.startTimeString + " to: " + this.endTimeString + ")";
* Returns a String representation of an Event task that is used to write to a file.
* @return The String representation of an Event task in the format used to write to a file.
* This class encapsulates the taskList of Rat, which is a list of tasks.
* Includes methods to add, modify, and delete tasks.
* The list of tasks managed by RatTaskManager, represented by an ArrayList.
* The RatStorage object used to read and write the task list to local storage.
* Checks if stored file is empty and reads data from file if it is not.
* Updates taskList with data from file.
* Returns a list of tasks matching a given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return A list of tasks matching a given keyword.
* Prints a list of tasks matching a given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return A String representation of the list of tasks matching a given keyword.
String output = "No tasks found matching the keyword " + "\"" + keyword + "\"" + ".";
str.append("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Reads the data from the local storage file and adds it to the taskList.
* Returns the String representation of RatTaskManager.
* The String representation is a numbered list of tasks.

* @param item Name of the ToDo task.
printWithLines("Got it. I've added this Deadline:\n"
+ "\nNow you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");

public void addDeadline(String deadline, String name) {

+ "\nNow you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Adds an Event task to the taskList, given its start time, end time, and name.

* Marks a task as done, given its 1-indexed index in the taskList.
* @param index Index of the task in the taskList.
printWithLines("Nice! I've marked this task as done: " + taskList.get(index - 1).toString());
* Marks a task as not done, given its 1-indexed index in the taskList.

printWithLines("Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet: " + taskList.get(index - 1).toString());

* @param index Index of the task in the taskList.
+ "\nNow you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Formats the taskList's String representation with a message and count.
printWithLines("You have no tasks in the list.");
String list = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n"
+ "You have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Method that updates local storage after each run of Rat.
* Writes the most updated taskList to the local storage file.
* @param name The name of the task.
* Method that changes the status of the task to done.
